usefulItems: cling film, fine mesh sieve, long sharp knife, jug, ice cream machine, fridge, freezer
title: Chocolate and Sesame Ganache

ingredients.content: 200 g dark chocolate (64%), small pieces or callets
200 g milk chocolate, small pieces or callets
250 g double cream, semi whipped (soft peak stage)
20 g stem ginger in syrup, syrup only
50 g stem ginger, chopped in small pieces
16 halved walnuts, for grating over plates
4 pears, medium, peeled, sliced (1 mm) then cut in 2 cm discs

preparations.content: <b>Insert butterfly whisk<b>. Place 125 g double cream, cocoa powder, glucose and salt in mixing bowl then mix <b>2 min/50°C/speed 2<b>.

Without measuring cup, set <b>speed 1<b> and slowly add dark chocolate and milk chocolate through hole in mixing bowl lid. Melt <b>5 min/40°C/speed 1<b>. Transfer to a bowl and set aside. Clean mixing bowl and butterfly whisk.
<b>Insert butterfly whisk<b>. Place egg yolks in mixing bowl then whisk <b>3 min/speed 4<b>, until pale and creamy.

Place a jug on mixing bowl lid then weigh in sesame oil and vegetable oil. Without measuring cup, set <b>speed 3<b>. Slowly drizzle in oils. Fold into chocolate mixture. Then fold in semi-whipped cream.
Using cling film, form mixture into 4 x 32 cm x Ø 3 cm logs. Place in fridge to set for approx. 6 hours, preferably overnight. Clean mixing bowl.

Place milk, double cream, glucose, trimoline, milk powder and ginger in mixing bowl then boil <b>5 min/100°C/speed 5<b>. Transfer to a bowl, leave to cool, then allow to infuse overnight in the fridge. Clean mixing bowl.
The next day, strain infused liquid and place in mixing bowl.

Add egg yolks, sugar and syrup then cook <b>6 min/85°C/speed 5<b>. Strain through a fine sieve then churn in an ice cream machine (see tip for alternative method). Add ginger near end of churning. Store in freezer until required. Clean mixing bowl.
Place pears in mixing bowl and chop <b>5 sec/speed 5<b>.

Add butter and sugar then cook <b>5 min/100°C/speed <b>. Blend <b>2 min/speed 6<b>. Remove mixing bowl and leave to cool. Add lemon juice. Pass through a fine sieve then cover and place in fridge to cool. Remove 30 minutes before required.
Remove chocolate ganache logs from fridge and trim either end through cling film, using a sharp knife dipped in hot water. Cut 3 even cylinders from each log then remove cling film.

Place a ganache cylinder on a plate. Place some grated walnuts next to it then add a scoop of ginger ice cream on top of walnuts. Dot pear purée around the plate. Arrange pear discs and remaining grated walnuts over the plate. Dress with a little coriander cress before serving.

hintsAndTricks: Slice the pears on a mandolin into <b>1 mm<b> slices then cut out discs using a <b>2 cm<b> pastry cutter.

To make ice cream without an ice cream machine - pour mixture into ice cube trays and freeze until solid. Place ice cream cubes in mixing bowl and chop <b>20 sec/speed 6<b>. Add stem ginger pieces then, while stirring with spatula through hole in mixing bowl lid, churn <b>10 sec/speed 4<b>.
